intro: Pavetta edentula, commonly known as the smooth pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that disperses seeds through mechanical means when it bursts open.
